examples: His plays are too entertaining!
It's entertaining.
These headstrong heroines provide an entertaining anchor for their tumultuous romantic narratives.
It's entertaining for us.
For one, it'd be more entertaining.
words.defineEn: being amusing or giving enjoyment
words.defineVi: đang gây cười hoặc mang lại sự thích thú

examples: Many people are just spending more time at home and exploring new ways to stay entertained.
He starts reading to himself and then, as he's looking at the paper, I think he's pretty entertained with my paper that he's got in his hand.
words.defineEn: pleasantly occupied
words.defineVi: vui vẻ chiếm đóng

examples: She picked up the globe artichoke from the market, excited to try a new recipe.
We gathered elderberries, excited to use the aggregate fruits for making jams and pies.
It doesn't particularly excite her.
When hiking in areas with wildlife, it's important to remain quiet and avoid making sudden movements, as the bleating of the kid can excite the tiger
The ghost kitchen world excites me.
words.defineEn: to make a person feel eager, interested, or happy, particularly about something that will happen soon
words.defineVi: để làm cho một người cảm thấy háo hức, quan tâm, hoặc hạnh phúc, đặc biệt là về một cái gì đó sẽ xảy ra sớm

examples: Holy moly, this is exciting news!

Hockey is an exciting sport played on ice or field, with sticks and a small puck or ball.
Take the initiative and fill your life with exciting experiences.
They claim drag racing is the most exciting motor sport.
words.defineEn: making us feel interested, happy, and energetic
words.defineVi: khiến chúng ta cảm thấy thích thú, hạnh phúc và tràn đầy năng lượng

examples: I'm excited about the next episode of my favorite TV show.
The children were excited to try the unusual-looking dragon fruit, an exotic accessory fruit.
The children were excited to learn about colors in art class.
We are excited to travel to our friend's wedding in another state.
She was excited to buy new clothes for the summer season.
words.defineEn: feeling very happy, interested, and energetic
words.defineVi: cảm thấy rất hạnh phúc, thích thú và tràn đầy năng lượng

examples: The bank raised interest rates.
Everyone has different interests.
My parents always took an interest in my hobbies.
The movie trailer piqued my interest in the film.
These discussions held little interest for Lucy.
words.defineEn: to find something attractive enough to want to know about it more or keep doing it
words.defineVi: để tìm một cái gì đó đủ hấp dẫn để muốn biết về nó nhiều hơn hoặc tiếp tục làm điều đó

examples: You raise some interesting points.
We had a very interesting discussion about climate change.
It's an interesting proposal.
All of them had an interesting story to tell.
The game's premise and mechanics are interesting, but there's just no meat on the bone when it comes to story and gameplay variety.
words.defineEn: catching and keeping our attention because of being unusual, exciting, etc.
words.defineVi: thu hút và giữ sự chú ý của chúng tôi vì khác thường, thú vị, v.v.

examples: Pass the salt, please.
Please make a note of the dates.
Close the door, please.
Can I have a Coke, please?
Please write your name on the paper.
words.defineEn: to make someone satisfied or happy
words.defineVi: để làm cho ai đó hài lòng hoặc hạnh phúc

examples: Getting rid of noise enhances the quality of your audio and makes it sound more pleasing to the ears.
Oh that's acoustically pleasing.
That is a sharp Telephoto and actually pretty pleasing natural voca to it as well.
In one study from 1960, participants reported that the more common word had a more pleasing sound 87% of the time.
Just one of those feel good, crowd pleasing deserts, that's just always a win.
words.defineEn: bringing the feelings of joy and satisfaction
words.defineVi: mang lại cảm giác vui vẻ và hài lòng

examples: Aren't you pleased to see me?
And didn't he just sound pleased as punch about that?
The artist didn't have any particular outcome in mind when she started painting, but was pleased with the final result.
It was safe to say I was pleased to see the back of it!
The artist was pleased when her painting sold for a high price at the gallery.
words.defineEn: feeling happy and satisfied with something that has happened or with someone's actions
words.defineVi: cảm thấy hạnh phúc và hài lòng với điều gì đó đã xảy ra hoặc với hành động của ai đó

examples: Let your body relax.
The hot water in the shower helped me relax after a long day.
We spent our vacation relaxing on the sandy beaches by the sea.
You sit down and relax.
As the sun beat down, they relaxed on the beach, sipping on cold beverages with slices of lime rind floating on top.
words.defineEn: to feel less worried or stressed
words.defineVi: để cảm thấy bớt lo lắng hoặc căng thẳng

examples: We should fill the bathtub with warm water for a relaxing bath.
My sister used to take a relaxing bath or shower before going to bed at night.
Costa Rica sounds like a great place for a relaxing vacation.
She sprinkled dried alkanet petals in her bathwater, turning it into a relaxing and visually appealing soak.
That was just so relaxing for me.
words.defineEn: helping our body or mind rest
words.defineVi: giúp cơ thể hoặc tâm trí của chúng tôi nghỉ ngơi

examples: I'm more relaxed now.
He must have been hoping for a relaxed time.
Rainy days make me feel calm and relaxed.
He managed to change the mood from tense to relaxed in minutes.
Your body is completely relaxed.
words.defineEn: feeling calm and at ease without tension or stress
words.defineVi: cảm thấy bình tĩnh và thoải mái mà không căng thẳng hay căng thẳng

examples: Mixing citron juice with honey and warm water makes a soothing morning drink.
Soothing, soothing.
It's very settling, very soothing.
Because hearing someone's voice can be so soothing.
It's delicious, soothing, sensuous, and it's had a hold on us for thousands of years.
words.defineEn: providing a calming or comforting sensation that helps to relieve or lessen pain
words.defineVi: mang lại cảm giác êm dịu hoặc thoải mái giúp giảm hoặc giảm đau

examples: The aromatic wintergreen tea soothes her sore throat.
He brewed a cup of ginger tea to soothe his upset stomach.
He brewed a cup of costmary tea to soothe his upset stomach after a heavy meal.
The herbalist recommended an anise infusion to soothe their upset stomach.
He brewed a cup of lavender tea to soothe his mind and reduce stress.
words.defineEn: to reduce the severity of a pain
words.defineVi: để giảm mức độ nghiêm trọng của một cơn đau

examples: Hot beverages stimulate sweating.
The voltage from our musical signal is stimulating our cockroach leg.

Instead, the current was stimulating the angular gyrus, which blends vision with body sense.
And reflex arcs stimulate some muscles, while inhibiting others.
words.defineEn: to encourage or provoke a response, reaction, or activity
words.defineVi: để khuyến khích hoặc kích động một phản ứng, phản ứng, hoặc hoạt động

examples: So it's always stimulating.

So caffeine stops adenosine from doing its thing, while some stimulating neurotransmitters are still around.
and I'm getting him out into different stimulating environments, he perks up, he gets pretty curious.
words.defineEn: rousing or quickening activity or the senses
words.defineVi: kích thích hoặc tăng tốc hoạt động hoặc các giác quan

examples: Stimulated emission might also help explain the observations made inside planes and subs.
Through a process called stimulated emission, air molecules shed that extra energy as a glowing light we see as ball lightning.
words.defineEn: emotionally aroused
words.defineVi: xúc động

examples: They still have some surprises up their sleeves.

They were surprised by the unique taste of burdock chips, a healthier alternative to regular potato chips.
I planned a surprise party for my little sister's birthday.
He surprised his guests at a dinner party by presenting a unique dessert twist on cheese fondue.
words.defineEn: to make someone feel mildly shocked
words.defineVi: để làm cho ai đó cảm thấy sốc nhẹ

examples: But it's not really surprising that this accommodation should happen.
It’s not surprising when you consider that he only arrived six months ago.
It’s not surprising when you consider that he only arrived six months ago.
During the chess tournament, Jane was confident in her skills, but her opponent ended up cleaning her clock with a series of surprising moves.
It's not that politicians carry two faces under one hood that is so surprising, but the fact that so many people accept such phony façades as the truth.
words.defineEn: causing a feeling of shock, disbelief, or wonder
words.defineVi: gây ra cảm giác sốc, hoài nghi hoặc ngạc nhiên

examples: She was surprised to find Chinese cabbage at the grocery store.

Mark was surprised to find out that his close friend, Alex, swings both ways.
words.defineEn: feeling or showing surprise or wonder
words.defineVi: cảm thấy hoặc thể hiện sự ngạc nhiên hoặc thắc mắc

examples: She gently touched the soft fur of the cat.
A regular newsletter keeps people in touch with local events.
My parents were constantly in touch.
The Rangpur slices added a vibrant touch to my summer fruit salad.
The leather sofa adds a touch of elegance to the room.
words.defineEn: affect emotionally
words.defineVi: ảnh hưởng đến cảm xúc

examples: The speech was so touching that I had a lump in my throat.

- That's touching.

words.defineVi: gợi ra một phản ứng cảm xúc mạnh mẽ, đặc biệt là sự cảm thông, dịu dàng hoặc buồn bã

examples: yeah she reduced us all to blubbering idiots and we were very happy but at the same time we felt very touched.
words.defineEn: deeply moved or emotionally affected by something, often in a positive or sentimental way
words.defineVi: cảm động sâu sắc hoặc bị ảnh hưởng về mặt cảm xúc bởi một cái gì đó, thường theo cách tích cực hoặc tình cảm

examples: but then we hit trouble.

words.defineEn: move deeply
words.defineVi: di chuyển sâu

examples: These policies are troubling.

It is very troubling!

words.defineEn: making one feel worried, upset, or uneasy about something
words.defineVi: làm cho một người cảm thấy lo lắng, buồn bã, hoặc không thoải mái về một cái gì đó

examples: His ideas caused real dissension within the party at first, but he poured oil on troubled waters in last night's speech.

words.defineVi: (của một người) lo lắng hoặc lo lắng

And it literally amazes me they don't understand that.

examples: The paneer curry smells amazing!
It’s amazing.

That's amazing Ralph.

examples: He was amazed that she would have the gall to show herself.

words.defineVi: cảm thấy hoặc hiển thị sự ngạc nhiên lớn

examples: Opera bores the pants off him.

words.defineVi: để làm một cái gì đó khiến một người trở nên không quan tâm, mệt mỏi, hoặc thiếu kiên nhẫn

examples: The movie was as boring as they come.

I have to do the same boring jobs day in day out.

This course seemed right up my alley when I signed up for it, but it ended up being dreadfully boring.
words.defineEn: making us feel tired and unsatisfied because of not being interesting
words.defineVi: khiến chúng ta cảm thấy mệt mỏi và không hài lòng vì không thú vị

examples: People will also simply get bored.
I was bored.
I was bored.
- I'm bored.
I'm bored.

words.defineVi: mệt mỏi và không vui vì không có gì để làm hoặc vì chúng ta không còn hứng thú với điều gì đó

examples: That so depresses me, but anyway.

words.defineEn: to make someone feel extremely sad, unhappy, or discouraged, often as a result of challenging situations, such as loss
words.defineVi: để làm cho ai đó cảm thấy vô cùng buồn bã, không vui, hoặc nản lòng, thường là kết quả của các tình huống khó khăn, chẳng hạn như mất mát

words.defineEn: feeling very unhappy and having no hope
words.defineVi: cảm thấy rất buồn và không có hy vọng

examples: You may be disappointed when a rainy day puts the kibosh on your picnic plans.

words.defineVi: cảm thấy buồn vì điều gì đó mà người ta hy vọng đã không xảy ra hoặc không như người ta mong đợi; để làm cho ai đó cảm thấy như thế này

examples: It's true that reality is disappointing.

words.defineEn: not fulfilling expectations

words.defineEn: not satisfied with something, especially because one expected otherwise
words.defineVi: không hài lòng với một cái gì đó, đặc biệt là bởi vì một mong đợi khác
